DOC.brief_summary: Background : Intravenous infusion lidocaine may decrease postoperative pain speed return bowel function . The investigator therefore test hypothesis include perioperative lidocaine infusion improve recovery laparoscopic colectomy shorten duration hospitalization . Methods : Forty patient schedule laparoscopic colectomy randomly allocate receive intravenous lidocaine ( bolus injection 1.5 mg.kg-1 lidocaine induction anesthesia , continuous infusion 2 mg.kg-1.h-1 intraoperatively 1.33 mg.kg-1.h-1 24 h postoperatively ) equal volume saline . All patient receive similar intensive postoperative rehabilitation . Postoperative pain score , opioid consumption , fatigue score measure . Times first flatus , defecation , hospital discharge record . Postoperative endocrine ( cortisol catecholamine ) metabolic ( leucocyte , C-reactive protein , glucose ) responses measured 48 h. Data ( median [ 25 % -75 % interquartile range ] Saline v Lidocaine group ) analyze use Mann-Whitney test . P < 0.05 consider statistically significant .
